overview_summary: None of the five Selkirk neighbors have an openly documented stance on development, with all classified as "unknown" in the absence of public statements. Community influence among these neighbors is low overall; none hold prominent official roles, indicating limited direct sway in local affairs.

neighbors.name: Charles Golding
neighbors.claims: Charles Golding, a Selkirk resident, passed away on July 6, 2023 at age 88 [Albany Times Union](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/timesunion-albany/name/charles-golding-obituary?id=52434272). He had lived in Selkirk for many decades, retiring as maintenance manager at Blue Circle Cement (now LaFarge) in 1997 and later driving a school bus for 14 years [Albany Times Union](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/timesunion-albany/name/charles-golding-obituary?id=52434272). Golding also co-owned the local Midway Cafe (established 1996) and was active with Boy Scouts, youth sports, and as a church lector in the community [Albany Times Union](https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/timesunion-albany/name/charles-golding-obituary?id=52434272).

approach_recommendations.engage: Work through his surviving family to engage the Golding household, emphasizing respect for their decades-long community presence and family legacy in Selkirk.

neighbors.name: Joanne Hornberger
neighbors.claims: Joanne Hornberger has no record of publicly voicing support or opposition to local development proposals [Albany Times Union](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/bethlehem-proposition-2-farmland-controversy-17533429.php). She is not known to hold any civic or leadership positions in the community, indicating a low public profile in town affairs [Albany Times Union](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/bethlehem-proposition-2-farmland-controversy-17533429.php).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach her in person to build trust and learn her priorities, emphasizing respect for her property rights and rural lifestyle.

neighbors.name: George Langdon
neighbors.claims: George Langdon has not publicly stated any position on development projects, nor is he mentioned in recent local planning or zoning debates in Bethlehem [Albany Times Union](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/bethlehem-proposition-2-farmland-controversy-17533429.php). No evidence was found of Langdon serving in any government or advocacy role, suggesting limited influence in the public arena [Albany Times Union](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/bethlehem-proposition-2-farmland-controversy-17533429.php).

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in a neighborly manner and listen to his perspective. Emphasize that any project plans will address local infrastructure and environmental factors important to nearby residents.

neighbors.name: John P. Granich Jr.
neighbors.claims: John P. Granich Jr. was employed as a shift supervisor in the New York State Assembly, with public records indicating he held that role from 2010 through 2014 [GovSalaries](https://govsalaries.com/granich-john-p-87985646). He has not been identified in local Bethlehem meeting records or news reports regarding development issues, implying no recorded stance or activism in that arena [Albany Times Union](https://www.timesunion.com/news/article/bethlehem-proposition-2-farmland-controversy-17533429.php).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage him with a straightforward, fact-based discussion, recognizing his familiarity with government processes. Providing detailed information on regulations and community benefits may align with his professional perspective.

neighbors.name: Jon H. Audietis
neighbors.claims: Jon Audietis and his wife operate a small family farm business called “Farmer Jon’s” at 1943 Route 9W in Selkirk [Albany Times Union](https://www.timesunion.com/churchill/article/Churchill-17669381.php). In 2022, their farm garnered local attention for giving away leftover Christmas trees to families in need, demonstrating the Audietis family’s strong community spirit and generosity [Albany Times Union](https://www.timesunion.com/churchill/article/Churchill-17669381.php).

approach_recommendations.engage: A personal, goodwill-oriented approach is recommended. Emphasize opportunities for community benefits or partnerships that align with the Audietis family’s demonstrated community spirit and values.
